sections.title: Current IAM Security Posture
sections.goal: Understand the present state of the Aegis IAM system, including controls, monitoring, and adherence to company policies like POL-SEC-001.
sample_questions: Can you describe the current RBAC model and how it aligns with POL-SEC-001?
What monitoring and alerting mechanisms are in place for unauthorized access attempts?
How often do you perform access reviews, and what triggers an out-of-cycle review?

sections.title: Incident Handling and Runbook Efficacy
sections.goal: Assess how incidents are handled, with reference to RB-IAM-075, and determine if runbooks are effective and up to date.
sample_questions: Walk me through the last time you used RB-IAM-075 for an emergency access revocation.
How do you ensure runbook steps are consistent with the latest RFC-903 Policy-as-Code conventions?
Have you encountered cases where the runbook was insufficient or outdated? How did you handle that?

sections.title: Integration with Other Systems
sections.goal: Explore how Aegis IAM integrates with other Novereon projects, assessing security implications and dependencies.
sample_questions: How does Aegis IAM integrate with Orion Edge Gateway for mTLS authentication?
What dependencies exist between IAM and the Nimbus Observability project for security event logging?
Have you identified any cross-project vulnerabilities or misconfigurations?

sections.title: Policy Enforcement and Automation
sections.goal: Evaluate automation in policy enforcement, looking at least privilege, JIT access, and compliance evidence.
sample_questions: How is JIT access provisioned and revoked automatically?
What automated checks are in place to ensure least privilege is maintained over time?
How do you collect and store compliance evidence for audits like AUD-24-Q2?

sections.title: Risk Assessment and Future Improvements
sections.goal: Identify known risks, possible mitigations, and tradeoffs for future IAM enhancements.
sample_questions: What’s the most significant current risk in Aegis IAM operations?
If you had to choose between reducing RTO or RPO for IAM, which would you prioritize and why?
What are your top priorities for improving security without impacting usability?
